item.title: Report E-2024080726
item.description:
Report E-2024080726

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-02T09:14:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-19
  • City: IRVING
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 19, 2024, four (4) 1-gallon jugs of UN1789 were damaged in transit and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH crew deployed granular absorbents and worked them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and the damaged jugs were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080701
item.description:
Report E-2024080701

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-16
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 16, 2024, ten (10) 1-gallon pails of contact cement were crushed in transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the contact cement-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum, and ten (10) 1-gallon pails of contact cement were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080639
item.description:
Report E-2024080639

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-15
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 15, 2024. four (4) 1-gallon containers of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of paint to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel collected four (4) damaged 1-gallon containers of paint and containerized them into one (1) 55-gallon drum as waste. LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted surfaces of the trailer and worked them in with hand tools. All paint (UN1263) impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 5-gallon container

item.title: Report E-2024080666
item.description:
Report E-2024080666

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-25
  • City: GARLAND
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal LGT. Lone Star Hazmat Response, LLC was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted an 8ft-by-4ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that two (2) gallons of material was released. Lone Star Hazmat Response, LLC personnel neutralized the area, deployed absorbents, and then swept up the released material. The damaged bottles and recovered material were placed into two (2) 55-gallon poly drums and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization

item.title: Report E-2024080660
item.description:
Report E-2024080660

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-24
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 20-gallons of service pro-non-chlorinated brake cleaner released from one 55-gallon metal drum. the release impacted the concrete dock. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and the caller determined that terminal staff were capable of cleaning the release with the available PPE on-site.

item.title: Report E-2024080661
item.description:
Report E-2024080661

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-24
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release. ERTS dispatched E3 Environmental to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 4ft-by-4ft area of the packaging and products and estimated that one (1) gallon of material was released. E3 Environmental personnel moved all the products from the pallet, used soda ash and water to neutralize the impacted areas, and then cleaned the released material. The damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) 85-gallon poly drum and the recovered material was placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum for disposal.
